node.title: Jacqueline de Jong Paints It All
node.description: At 82, the artist continues to make works that respond to the world around her, whether they comment on the migrant crisis or transform the potatoes she grows in her garden.

node.title: Evictions are mounting in the United States, but at a slower pace than many tenants and advocates feared.
N.Y.’s governor promises grants for employers and laid-off workers in the ailing tourism industry.
node.description: Ms. Hochul said the state would make payments of $2,750 to as many as 36,000 workers who lost jobs during the pandemic as part of a $450 million package to help the tourism industry.

node.title: Police Tell Woman They Can't Help After Ex Allegedly Trashed Her Property in Viral Video
node.description: "I know it's frustrating but she has certain laws she has to abide by," one commenter said in defense of the law enforcement official.

node.title: Indiana School District Sued Over Transgender Restroom Access, Use of Wrong Names
node.description: "The refusal to allow a student to use the correct restroom can be extremely damaging," ACLU of Indiana legal director Ken Falk said.

node.title: Woman Injured at Charlottesville Rally Tells Court 'Emotional' Scars Worse Than 'Physical'
node.description: Blair received minor physical injuries from her fiancé Marcus Martin pushing her out of the way as a car sped toward the crowd.

node.title: Alabama Adds Bronze Busts of Two Female Voting Rights Pioneers to State Archives
node.description: Amelia Boynton Robinson and Pattie Ruffner Jacobs became the first women to be added to the Statuary Hall of Notable Alabamians.

node.title: EPA investigating possible illegal oil disposal in Adelaide's Chinatown
node.description: South Australia's Environment Protection Authority is investigating whether traders have tipped oil down public drains, damaging pavers that were just installed as part of a $4 million redevelopment.

node.title: Victoria records 1,069 new local COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths
node.description: There are now 15,607 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 376 people have died during the state's current Delta outbreak.

node.title: Pennsylvania Lifting School Mask Mandate in January, Turning Decision to School Districts
node.description: Pennsylvania's governor has announced in January that K-12 students may return to school without masks amid district over his previous mandate.

node.title: Just 12 Percent of Calls to Virginia Employment Commission Are Answered, New Report Says
node.description: "It's clear that additional oversight and assistance is needed," Joint Legislative Audit and Review Commission leader Lauren Axselle said.

node.title: Kaboom! Ohio Governor Approves Legal Launching of Fireworks on Certain Holidays
node.description: The previous law permitted residents to purchase consumer-grade fireworks within state borders, but they were required to move them out of Ohio within 48 hours.

node.title: Oscar Pistorius up for parole but must meet parents of murdered Reva Steenkamp
node.description: The parents of murdered model Reva Steenkamp want to meet with her killer, Oscar Pistorius, before his parole hearing.

node.title: COVID left Sherene on 'death's doorstep'. More than 12 months later, she's still in pain
node.description: Sherene Magana Cruz was put into an induced coma and spent weeks in ICU when she caught COVID-19. She had no idea she'd still be suffering more than a year later.

node.title: House January 6 committee subpoenas Trump campaign leadership and associates
node.description: Among those subpoenaed were Trump 2020 campaign manager William Stepien, senior advisor Jason Miller.

node.title: David Hussey on how Australia can take down 'classy' Pakistan as T20 World Cup final looms
node.description: Overcoming unbeaten Pakistan in the T20 World Cup semi-finals shapes as a difficult task for Australia but former T20 international David Hussey has some tips on what his former team needs to do to reach the final.

node.title: Northern Ireland row puts UK-EU trade deal under threat
node.description: Former UK Prime Minister Sir John Major warns suspending parts of the Northern Ireland Protocol Brexit deal would be a "colossally stupid" move.

node.title: Air NZ to require vaccination or negative Covid-19 test for domestic flights
node.description: All passengers on Air New Zealand domestic flights will need to be fully vaccinated or have a negative Covid-19 test from mid-December. Audio
